intro: Lepidosperma rigidulum, commonly known as the rigid sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Its leaves are stiff and ribbed, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Lepidosperma rigidulum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
